channel.title: (Woodcutting) ~ Steven556's First SCAR Script ~

item.title: (Woodcutting) ~ Steven556's First SCAR Script ~
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

Yeah, we encourage you to use SRL in your script, helps a LOT, the script you made is frankly…horrible lol.

Look through some tuts on how to include srl, how to make a simple wooductting script, and stuff like that.

Here is an example that uses srl, it finds the tree color, moves the mouse to the color, right clicks, chooses the “Chop” option, and waits 5 seconds with a randoms of 3 seconds added. Don’t use this script though, very basic and not reliable, its just an example of using srl.

Adding random times added to your normal waits decreases you getting banned, the Mouse(x, y, 2, 2, False) also moves like a human would move the mouse with a randomness of 2 by 2 pixels of the exact spot to click (can be increased or decreases), but you get the idea.

[code]Program ChopDownTree;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

const
TreeColor = 541235; //change to the tree color

Procedure ChopTheTree;
begin
if(Findcolor(x,y,TreeColor,MSX1, MSY1, MSX2, MSY2))then //finds the color of the tree(TreeColor) on the main screen
begin
Mouse(x, y, 2, 2, False); //right clicks the tree
Wait(500 + random(500));
ClickOption(‘Chop’, 1); //clicks the “Chop” option
Wait(5000 + random(3000));
end else
begin
Writeln(‘The tree color was not found’);
end;
end;

begin
SetupSRL;
repeat
ChopTheTree;
until(false);
end.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: (Woodcutting) ~ Steven556's First SCAR Script ~
item.dc:creator: @reece844 reece844
item.description:
@reece844 wrote:

use mmouse(x, y, 3, 3,) as your move mouse function(3s are tolerence)and
use mouse(x, y, True)as your click function *Or you can make your own which may take a while

Here is some advice that helped me, look around in the SRL include and look at other scripts
people have made to look at what they did.

item.title: (Woodcutting) ~ Steven556's First SCAR Script ~
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Well, theres alot wrong.

First of all, these coordinates might not always be the same, so using them is highly discouraged.
second of all, Movemouse and clickmouse itself is an auto-ban, and having no random points to click makes it all the worse.
Lastly, all you did was movemouse, wait, clickmouse, wait, movemouse, etc.
Try making that into a procedure, so that your main loop can look less cluttered.

Sure it may compile, but theres not much too it. It’ a good try for a first script, as everybody starts somewhere. Now that you have the basic setup of scar in your head, try going deeper and using more than two commands. Also, variables and constants (especially) can come in handy when writing out scripts.

Try using SRL includes, such as Mouse or MMouse for anti-ban.

Read full topic

item.title: (Woodcutting) ~ Steven556's First SCAR Script ~
item.dc:creator: @steven556 steven556
item.description:
@steven556 wrote:

Hey, I’ve kind of been bored with making private servers, so I decided to try making SCAR Scripts.

I learned this from WhoCares57, (Thanks Dude :D). Please tell me if there is anything wrong. ( I am new, go easy on me… )

[code]program LogStriker;

begin
Movemouse(250,312);
wait(1000);
Clickmouse(250,312,true);
wait(1000);
Clickmouse(508, 264,true);

Movemouse(379, 309);
wait(100);
Clickmouse(379, 309,true);
wait(1000);
Clickmouse(508, 264,true);

Movemouse(507, 309);
wait(100);
Clickmouse(507, 309,true);
wait(1000);
Clickmouse(508, 264,true);

Movemouse(625, 311);
wait(100);
Clickmouse(625, 311,true);
wait(1000);
Clickmouse(508, 264,true);

Movemouse(752, 308);
wait(100);
Clickmouse(752, 308,true);
wait(1000);
Clickmouse(508, 264,true);

Movemouse(838, 311);
wait(100);
Clickmouse(838, 311,true);
wait(5000);

end.[/code]
